utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, one last box and I’m ready for college.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetheart, this is a lot of stuff. You do realize you don’t have to take all of this stuff with you to your dorm room. Like this. What is this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Remember? I wanted to ride my bike without training wheels. Like the big kids. And I did. So you got me my very own gold medal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well honey, that is a very sweet memory, but your dorm room is only so big. You’re going to have to leave some of this stuff behind.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Don’t listen to him, darling. Everybody needs their stuff.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My little girl is going to college.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Seems like just yesterday you were checking under the bed every night, promising her that monsters aren’t real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I lied. Monsters are real. They’re the boys in her freshman dorm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of which. Before Alexis leaves don’t you think you should have the, um … talk with her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean the sex talk? Mother, I covered that ages ago. I learned so much.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I mean the you and Beckett sex talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, Beckett and I have not –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Save it, Richard. I knew the morning I walked in here and the poor girl was hiding in the closet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Shh… shh… shh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mothers know these things. But I don’t think you want Alexis to walk in unannounced and find you and Beckett … out of the closet. And by out of the closet –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I – no – I know what you mean by out of the closet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. So. Don’t you think you should tell her?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Tell me what?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You told Alexis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t want to. Mother used her Jedi mind tricks on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She knows too? Castle, do they realize what’s at stake here? Because if Alexis tells Lanie –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis won’t tell Lanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s gonna tell Esposito. Esposito can’t keep his mouth shut with Ryan and Ryan’s gonna blow it out of proportion. And then Gates is gonna find out and we won’t be able to work together anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me. She knows what’s at stake and our secret is safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did she take it? Us … being together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was too preoccupied with her move to even comment. I mean, it’s ridiculous. She’s got boxes and boxes of stuff and apparently all of it’s important.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we all need our stuff, Castle. I’ve got boxes and boxes of it. It’s comforting. It reminds me of my past.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your kinky past?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got that box, too.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Housekeeping found her this morning. Name’s Wendy Dupree, 25 years of age, single gunshot to the chest. From a 9 millimeter. Unfortunately she died slowly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, long enough to write the word “lie”. So our killer wasn’t a pro. She wouldn’t have been left breathing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A dying declaration. But what does it mean?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey, that’s your department.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, did someone lie to her? Perhaps it’s the killer’s initials. Maybe a grammatical error; she should have written “lay”.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. Victim’s wallet. She came a long way to get killed. She’s a Philly girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long was she here for?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Front desk says she checked in yesterday afternoon. Alone.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: She wasn’t alone. She brought 4,000 of her closest friends.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That kind of cash, what she’s doing in a dump like this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, run financials. See what you guys can find. Castle, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think as much as I love a good mystery, she could have left a more helpful note.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here’s a message that needs no interpretation. “You think you can lie to me –“

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, maybe that’s the lie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: “- run all you want, I’m going to find you and make you pay.” It’s a 215 area code. That’s Philly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pull a warrant for the cell phone. I want to know who sent that text.

utterance.speaker: JOE PRATT
utterance.content: Yeah, I sent it. You bet I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it sounds like you had a big problem with her.

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Hell yeah, I had a problem. Wendy’s a waitress at my place. Joe’s Cheesesteaks. They’re the best in Philly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The best in Philly? That’s a tad presumptuous.

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Well it is. So yesterday I send that fraud to the bank to make a deposit for the restaurant, right? But does she make the drop? No. She hightails it up here with 4,000 of my dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lot of cheesesteak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you followed her to New York to get your money back.

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Damn right. I tried to be nice. Finally she calls me and she’s like “I’m sorry, it was an emergency. I’ll pay you back double when I get back.” Screw that. She stole from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And for that she deserved to die?

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: PRATT
utterance.content: Oh no. No. I didn’t do this. No, I couldn’t even find her. No, I – I just got off the train from Philly about an hour before you guys picked me up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Amtrak confirms that Pratt was ticketed yesterday, but they can’t be sure of what train he was on, so we’re double checking his alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have them check on that cheesesteak, too. There’s no way it’s the best in Philly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, even if it was him, it doesn’t explain Wendy’s mysterious emergency. The stolen cash, the sudden trip to New York City.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why she would write ‘lie’. You don’t write a dying message in blood just for kicks. There had to be a reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you out too? Want some more?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you know what? I’ll go get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Long Island Expressway”. “Literary Institute of Excellence”. “Love is everything.” Oh, did I just say that? I’m getting soft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett’s phone.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Castle? You’re not allowed to answer Beckett’s phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes I am.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since I – – can – is there something I can do for you?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Write this down. I’ve got a partial off the shell casing. No matches in the system or to Mr. Pratt, but I did find some trace DNA. Are you writing this down?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, hold on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oooh… you are in trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not in trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie got a partial print. It is not a match for Pratt. He is not our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who said that you could answer my phone? And why are you going through my drawers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was looking for a pad of paper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure you were. Stay out of my stuff, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your stuff? Need I remind you, I’ve already seen … your stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, some of my stuff is still private.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. An old boyfriend made that for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? ‘cause it’s totally cool. I wouldn’t be jealous. Okay, a little bit jealous. Not an old boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh uh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got it from a crime scene? That is a keepsake from the first murderer you ever collared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I told you, Castle. It’s private.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it’s the actual murder victim from a stick man convention.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? That’s the best that you can come up with?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Challenge accepted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, nothing in financials explain why Wendy needed four grand in cash, but I might’ve figured out what she was doing in town. She used her credit card for a cab ride to 8th and Market yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The day she was killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I spoke with the cabbie. Wendy took his business card, said she was going to call and have him take her back there today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bet we find our answers there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A self-storage warehouse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s a girl from Philly doing in a place like this?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. She was here. A lot less bloody when I saw her, though. She signed up for the auction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Auction?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Every month we auction off repossessed storage units. You know, from deadbeats that don’t pay their bills. There’s one going on right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what the four thousand dollars was for. She was going to bid on a unit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which unit?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Beats me. Could be any one of the fourteen we got up for bid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So there’s no way of telling which one she was interested in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, there is a way. We misinterpreted Wendy’s message. It’s not “lie”, we were looking at it upside down. It’s 3-1-7. That’s what she was trying to tell us. Is unit 317 up for auction?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, it is. Probably auctioning it off as we speak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wendy was killed trying to buy that unit. If we let it get sold off –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’ll lose our best shot at finding out who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: 317. You have 60 seconds to look in there before we start the bidding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Ryan said the owner of the unit was a Johann Fleming. Can you run that? Okay, thanks. We need you to stop this auction.

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: As much as I’d like to help, I’d like my money more. So unless you’ve got a warrant, I don’t have to stop jack.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Okay, 30 seconds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what do you see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … not much. Just a – – just a bunch of junk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, the key to Wendy’s murder might be in that junk and we’re about to lose it. There’s no way I can get a warrant in time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May not have a warrant but I’ve got something better. Checkbook!

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Auctions are cash only, hotshot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh no. What are we going to do? Is two grand enough?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing with two grand in your pocket?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m a best-selling author. Why wouldn’t I have two grand in my pocket?

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: All right, what are you going to give for it? Who starts out? Hundred dollar bid. Who’ll go a hundred dollars –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right here.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: One hundred dollars! Now who’ll go two – two hundred dollars –

utterance.speaker: PEGGY
utterance.content: Yep, yep!

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Two hundred, Peggy, thank you very much. Who’ll go three? Looking for three.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: I got three on it.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Big Percy’s in for three hundred dollars. Who wants to go four?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right here.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Pretty boy’s back in and he’s in for four hundred.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Frankie’s got five hundred. Who’s got six? Looking for six.

utterance.speaker: PEGGY
utterance.content: Yep, yep.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Peggy’s in for six hundred. Thank you very much. Who’s going seven?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seven hundred.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Seven hundred dollars. Thank you very much. Who’s going eight? Eight hundred dollars.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: I got eight on it.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Big Percy’s got eight. Who’s gonna go nine? Frankie’s got nine. Now looking for a thousand dollar bid. Who’s got a thousand dollars one time? Looking for a thousand dollars. Anybody here got a thousand dollar bid one time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fifteen hundred.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Fifteen hundred dollars! Anybody gonna top that? Anybody anywhere? Fifteen hundred going once, fifteen going twice –

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: Sixteen hundred.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Sweet sixteen, just under the wire. Now who’ll go seventeen? I got sixteen, now who’ll go seventeen? Looking for seventeen hundred dollar bid. Anybody have a seventeen. Seventeen hundred dollars -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve only got two thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here. Sign it. Keep bidding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. Hi, Big Percy, right? What would it take to get all the cash you have on you?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Depends on what you’re offering.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about a check. No, it’s good. I swear. It’s signed by the millionaire mystery novelist Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No really. He’s right behind me.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: For real?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: My mom loves his books. Okay. I’ll give you sixteen hundred. But it’ll cost twenty-five.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eighteen.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Twenty-three.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two grand and he’ll name a character in his next novel after your mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Sold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got thirty-six hundred, now make it work.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Who’ll go twenty four and a half? Give me twenty-four and a half one time. Who’ll go twenty-four and a half.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch this. Three thousand.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Three thousand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me, I got this.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Thirty one hundred. Who’ll go thirty one hundred one time? I think he might buy it. Who’ll go thirty one?

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: Three thousand fifty.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Thirty fifty, now do you want to go thirty one hundred? You go thirty one hundred one time let me hear it. You going thirty one hundred one time? What do you say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thirty five hundred.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Thirty five hundred dollars. Now you want to go thirty six?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’ve only got thirty six hundred.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I can do this all day. I’ll outbid myself. Thirty six.

utterance.speaker: AUCTIONEER
utterance.content: Thirty six hundred dollars. Anybody gonna top that? Anybody anywhere. Thirty six going once, thirty six going twice – bid now or forever hold your peace – sold to pretty boy for thirty six hundred. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you even know that was going to work?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well as a champion poker player I am a student of body language. I could tell by looking at him –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You had absolutely no idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a clue.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Congrats. All that junk is yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks.

utterance.speaker: PERCY
utterance.content: Oh and uh … My mother’s name is Eunice. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eunice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn, bro. You actually bought all this crap?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All this crap is going to crack this case wide open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, LT. You are so going to owe me for this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I don’t know if the department’s going to be able to reimburse you for all of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not the owing I mean.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ran down the name in unit 317, Johann Fleming. Address is bogus, name is bogus, the guy doesn’t exist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then whose stuff is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well the answer’s right in front of us. His stuff will tell us who he is. Look, there’s a box of maps. Um … he was a geography buff. He enjoyed travel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he was a trucker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, see? Progress.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh yo… climbing gear. He’s an outdoorsman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Super creepy outdoorsman.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, this is high end stuff, Castle. Can I have this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why not? You’re not a climber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I spent a lot of money on this stuff. You want something, make me an offer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here? Whose junk is this and what in the hell is it doing in my precinct?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s Castle’s, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sir? Actually it’s a part of an ongoing investigation.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t care. I want it gone, all of it!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Is that – oh, it is. Do you know what you have? How rare that piece is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir? Are you a collector?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ever since I was a kid. I have searched for years –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, search no more.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. It’s yours.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Really? Well I – I don’t know what – I

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Say you’ll accept.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh, carry on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you can give her something but you can’t give me something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you already like me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, mother lode. Tax returns. Looks like Johann Fleming’s actually Wendell Dupree.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same last name as our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and the same date of birth, too. They must be twins. Wait, twins. Of course. It all makes sense now. Wendell’s secret identity, Johann Fleming? It’s the same secret identity of Zan. The male half of the Wonder Twins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wonder Twins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Super Friends? Seriously, you guys, do you not watch TV?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If this unit belonged to her brother, then why was Wendy bidding on it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And why did he stop making payments? And why was he using an alias?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t we track down Wendell and ask him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don’t you buy a TV?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who knew that GATES had a softer side? It’s uh –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Creepy. Very, very creepy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where are we on the brother?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, turns out the twins had a hard knock life. Their parents died in a car crash when they were teens. It’s like Wendell never fully recovered. He moved from town to town, getting in scrapes with the law.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In an urn. He died. Six weeks ago. Hit by a subway train.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ouch. Explains why his storage bill wasn’t paid. Says here it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the subway cameras were broken so there’s really no way to know for sure. If his death is related to Wendy’s we could be looking at a second murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so that was one of Wendy’s fellow waitresses from Philly. According to her, Wendy was convinced her brother’s death wasn’t an accident. Apparently he was involved in something dangerous.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of dangerous?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wendy didn’t say, but according to this waitress just before the subway accident Wendell called his sister and said it was over and all of their problems were solved.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And yet he ends up dead and he was desperate enough to risk everything – job, jail – just to go after her brother’s storage unit. Why? I mean, we’ve been through all this stuff –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: - it just seems like a bunch of random junk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe it’s just that we don’t know exactly what we’re looking for. I mean, whoever killed Wendy most likely came from Wendell’s world, so what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: For the last three months, using his Wonder Twin alias, Wendell worked as a chauffeur for a one Angelica Henley, a wealthy socialite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Then let’s start here.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY SMITH
utterance.content: Good evening. Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were hoping to speak with Ms. Henley.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: The lady in the purple cocktail dress. May I take you to her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I think we can manage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Champagne?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m on duty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, alas. I’m forced to drink alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Angelica Henley.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA HENLEY
utterance.content: “An-hel-ica”. The ‘g’ is silent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t that make it “An-el-ica”?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: “An-hel-ica”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m Detective Kate Beckett and this is Mr. Castle. Can we have a word?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: What’s all this about? I have guests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now I understand you employed a man named Johann Fleming?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: Yes, and I was so heartbroken when the poor boy died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well were you aware that his real name was Wendell Dupree?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: No I wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: No, I – I don’t think so. You – you mean his name was Wendell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he in trouble? Was he involved in any illegal activities?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: No, no, no. The police cleared him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of what?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: Oh, a few days before he died I was robbed. Someone broke in here and cracked my wall safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did they take?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: My bracelet. That was made out of pink diamonds that was worth over $4 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wendell stole the bracelet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what’s in the storage unit. That’s why he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh oh oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What are you so happy about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is a four million dollar diamond bracelet buried in my auction winnings. I’m rich. Or richer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: ‘til Detective Beckett takes it from you and returns it to its rightful owner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but not even that can ruin my day because tonight is my very special “last night before college” dinner with my daughter.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: About that, can we cancel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Whoa. What? Why? Alexis, we made these plans months ago. Do you know how hard it is, even for me, to get reservations at –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If it’s the reservations you care so much about, why don’t you just take your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa Alexis, that’s not – that’s not –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexis hates me? Is it because we’re together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess she feels like she’s being replaced. Which is weird, because she’s never done this before. Not with Gina, not with the hundreds of super-hot girlfriends I’ve always had –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I don’t need to hear this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So do you think I should talk to her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. She’ll eat you alive. Let me handle it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Handle what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, uniforms are going through Wendell’s belongings looking for the bracelet, but robbery finally sent over the report on the break in at Angelica Henley’s. Take a look at these.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… real beauty. Certainly worth killing for. I am speaking of the bracelet, in case anyone is wondering.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was a two man job. Pretty sophisticated, too. One suspect put a bypass on the alarm in the basement –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The other rappelled from the roof and went in through the window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which explains the climbing equipment you had your eye on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Wendell was suspiciously hit by a train after stealing a diamond bracelet and then six weeks later his sister goes looking for his storage unit and she ends up dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if it’s a ’no honor among thieves’ thing. You said it was a two man job. What if Wendell’s partner decided he wanted the bracelet for himself? Only he killed Wendell before he figured out where he’d stashed it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he follows Wendy, she leads him to the storage unit, and then he kills her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Find the partner, find the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe we already found him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, do you remember at the auction? All of the bidders dropped out after fifteen hundred.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He knew what was inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why else would he bid so high?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Felix Cazarian, NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: Just a second!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s making a run for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop it!

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: I thought you were thieves trying to steal my stuff. I had absolutely no idea what was in the storage unit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, unlike anyone else there you bid us through the roof.

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: Lady, that’s strategy. I bid on a lot of things. That’s how I make my money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you actually sell this stuff.

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: Not yet. I’m still organizing. Cataloguing. There’s a method to all of this. You know, what I collect, what I bid on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Especially when you got inside information. You knew exactly what was inside that unit.

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: No I didn’t. Yeah, you know, I was thinking when I signed up for the auction there was a guy. Offered me $500 dollars to be his proxy. Get unit 317. Very specific. 317.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what’d you say?

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: I said no. $500 dollars, I’m not in for the short money. Made me curious. 317. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was probably Wendell’s partner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was he at the auction?

utterance.speaker: FELIX
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. I never saw him again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re gonna need you to sit with a sketch artist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Felix alibied out, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wendell’s partner. Ryan and Esposito are trying to ID him now. How about you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have ripped through everything in this room big enough to hide a bracelet. You know what I found?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely nothing. Save for these wicked nunchucks, which is how I broke the hotdog maker. Also some notable books. Slovakian polka music, prosthetic eye manufacturing, and my favorite, a history of Irish travelers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t get it. All the evidence, Wendy’s murder, everything points to the fact that that bracelet should be in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s not. I did however make headway on my little stickman theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Whilst you were still an officer you risked your life running into traffic to save an old gypsy woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A gypsy woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An old gypsy woman. To reward your bravery she gave you a talisman. She said as long as you keep it no harm will ever befall you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No harm will befall me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look all right to me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So Mr. Castle. I decided to give Frozen Heat a read. You know what? It’s really a good book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You liked it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I loved it! I uh – do you mind?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I – I ordered the rest of the Nikki Heat series.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Again, thank you for my Gemini collectible. I now have a complete set.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see that? She loves me now. And I’ve got that scary little monstrosity to thank for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? You need to see this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So robbery interviewed a guy named Marco Vinstrolli. His van got a parking ticket around the corner the night Angelica’s bracelet was stolen. Now they found nothing to connect him, but –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The storage manager said that he rented Marco a unit on the same floor the day before the auction. So I reviewed their surveillance tapes. This is from 6AM yesterday morning, 5 hours before the auction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He broke into my storage unit! It was Wendell’s at the time, but now it’s mine. Is that a safe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why we couldn’t find your bracelet, because it was in the safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So do we have a license on that van?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hands! Hands!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take your hands off your tool, Marco!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marco, we know that you and Wendell were partners. Your van was ticketed when you pulled the job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Robbery couldn’t prove it before, but now with these - Well, we got you.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: Ah, it seems like all you got me for is stealing a safe. What’s the punishment for that? 30 days?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like 30 years after we add Wendell and Wendy’s murders to it.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: Murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you tell us exactly what happened and we’ll get the DA to cut you a deal. But you better hurry because they’re cutting through that safe and when they find that diamond bracelet you’re on your own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I love about this case?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finding a pretty pink bracelet in my belongings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know you’re going to have to return it –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know! I know that. Can’t you just let me have this moment? This one, small, Treasure Island, Indiana Jones moment?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right. Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well it’s too late now. It’s ruined.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: All I did was help him get into that penthouse. I swear to God, I didn’t even know the guy. Johann – or Wendell – whatever, he paid me $5 grand to kill the alarms. No questions asked. We did the job, he came out happy, and said mission accomplished. We went separate ways.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except you still wanted the bracelet. So you went after him and you killed him.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: I didn’t even know he took that damn bracelet until I read about it in the papers. And by that time he was already dead. So I broke into Wendell’s. But all I found was a key marked storage unit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you didn’t know where that storage unit was.

utterance.speaker: MARCO
utterance.content: So I kept a close eye on upcoming auctions until I found one with Johann’s name. As soon as I saw the safe inside, I knew. That’s where he had stashed that diamond bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, I love this part. The kick of adrenaline, the quickening of the heart, those last few drops of anticipation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s empty. So where is the bracelet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wherever it is it’s laughing at me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Marco was wrong and Wendell sold it before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well then, where’s the money from the sale? No money means there should be a bracelet. No bracelet means there should be money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think the question we should be asking is how did Wendell even pull off a heist like this to being with? Angelica said the thief cracked the wall safe. Do you know how hard it is to crack a wall safe? Especially because Wendell didn’t even have the proper equipment in his storage unit. It just doesn’t –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doesn’t make any sense?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless Angelica wasn’t telling us the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen to this. Angelica was scheduled for a bankruptcy hearing a week ago but it was cancelled because she made a $2million dollar payment to her creditors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right after the insurance company paid her claim on the bracelet. What if this whole thing was a ploy to commit insurance fraud?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mission accomplished. That’s what Wendell said after the break in. Mission accomplished.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. He didn’t say he actually stole anything. The mission was to make it look like a robbery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the best way to make it look real and fool the police and the insurance company –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - is to actually break in yet steal nothing. Angelica set this whole thing up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the only other person that knew was Wendell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She couldn’t let him or his sister expose her secret.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I call that motive for murder and probable cause for a search warrant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Good work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: I’m sorry Ms. Henley, they just barged in. I tried to stop them.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: You people have no grounds to search my residence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually – – we do.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: This is outrageous!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s right. This is outrageous. And you know what you should do? Open that wall safe and prove us wrong.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fine. We can just tear it out of the wall if you like.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: No! No, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well is it there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This little beauty has caused a lot of trouble, hasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: That’s what beautiful things do, my dear. At least to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why didn’t you just sell it and solve all of your money problems instead of hiring Wendell to stage a robbery?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: I didn’t hire Wendell. I didn’t even know he was involved in all of this until you told me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the fact that he broke in the same night you called and reported this stolen, that’s just a coincidence?

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: Look, when I came home and saw that my apartment had been burglarized, I was – I was panicked. Shocked. Until I saw that nothing had been taken. So I thought that if I simply pretended that my bracelet had been stolen that would solve all my problems.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except you created two new problems. Your chauffeur and his sister, both of whom are now dead.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: I think it’s time for me to call my attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she admitted to insurance fraud hoping to avoid murder charges. At least, I think that’s her play.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. She’s a desperate woman on the verge of losing her wealth. That’s death to someone like her. She’s probably willing to do anything to avoid it. Lie, steal, cheat, and in this case, kill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it still doesn’t explain the storage locker. I mean, if Wendell didn’t steal anything, what did he put in there that his sister was so desperate to get? And if it didn’t have anything to do with her murder why would she write the locker number in her blood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you went through that storage unit with a fine-tooth comb. You said that there’s nothing of value in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well yeah, nothing of value to us but … What about something of value to them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. A trinket? An heirloom? The answer’s in there somewhere. It has to be. Anyway, it’s getting late. I have to drop off Alexis first thing in the morning. Fresh start tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Walk you out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know what? I gotta stick around. I’ve got to go over Angelica’s alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh I so wish I could kiss you right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is me, softly touching your face, pulling you in for a long, slow kiss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And this is me, kissing you back, running my hands through your hair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best handshake ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think my hand’s getting a little sweaty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, it’s kinda gross.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No worries.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Alexis. My darling, farewell. God knows when we shall meet again. That’s Shakespeare, you know.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right. No farewells, no goodbyes, just see you later, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: See you later, Gram.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’ll be in the hall, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … this is your new home, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, look. I get it. I do. But whatever happens between Beckett and me, I want you to know – I mean, we could break up tomorrow, we could spend the rest of our lives together, but – she will never take your place in my heart.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why would I be worried about Detective Beckett replacing me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … well … you were acting … I thought -

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How can you be so smart and so clueless at the same time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Practice?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is no more about Beckett than it’s about the fact that my mother isn’t here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry honey, but your mom, she’s in –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. Not it’s fine. It’s always been fine. Because no matter what, I’d wake up and you’d be there. And I’d know that everything’s fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, and when you wake up here –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m here. And you’re there. Even though there is only 5 miles away, it’s not here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s going to be fine. And you are going to be fine. And though I am there, if you need me here, here’s where I’ll be.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, dad? I – I know it’s been awhile, but um … could you do it? One last time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No monsters.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And if there are, I’ll come running.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, are you crying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s allergies. Pollen count is high.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Pollen count’s gotten to me, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can get home by yourself, right?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks! Love you, Mother!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know where it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where what is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know what it is, only where it is. Whatever Wendell stole was only of value to him and his twin sister. So he would hide it in the one place only she would look. Wendy, Wendell, twins. As in Gemini. Collectibles? This is it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s empty. Well that can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, just breathe.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What the hell have you done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You – you thought what, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just thought that Wendell would have hidden what he stole inside the Gemini collectible –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It wasn’t Wendell’s! It was mine! I brought it in from home this morning!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, that’s my bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, that means – – ah, here it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A USB drive and a glass eye?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t see that coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the photos from this USB drive are from a crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crime scene where?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mercer, Pennsylvania. They’re about a decade old. It was a hit and run.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What does any of this have to do with a glass eye? And weren’t the twins parents killed in a car crash 10 years ago?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, they were rear ended and their car went down an embankment. Reports said that they were trapped inside and bled out and that if the person that hit them had stopped and called for help they might have lived.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Who took this photo? It’s from the crime scene and it’s of a broken glass eye.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Glass eye? Wait a minute. Of course. It all makes sense now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It does?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wendell’s obsession. Why he moved from place to place. Why he came to New York. Why he used a fake name and had a book on prosthetic eyes. He was – he was on a mission.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but on a mission to do what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well to find the person responsible for his parent’s deaths. In order to be sure Wendell had to steal his suspect’s glass eye. That’s what the heist was about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And like fingerprints he used that photo to compare the eyes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A la Richard Kimble but instead of looking for a one-armed man –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was looking for a one-eyed man. Or in our case, a one-eyed woman.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: I’m not saying a word without my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t have to, but you might want to listen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know what Wendell stole.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: That’s it. I’m calling my attorney.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve worked a lot of murder cases, waiting patiently for the day I could unequivocally exclaim – - the butler did it!

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It must have been a shock, all these years later, after you put all that behind you, to have someone walk into your life and stir it all back up again.

utterance.speaker: ANGELICA
utterance.content: Kirby! What’s he talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your live-in butler cause a car accident and then fled the scene. Because he did, two people lost their lives. Those people were Wendell’s parents.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: That is absolutely ridiculous. You can’t prove any of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your DNA was on the prosthetic eye that Wendell stole. And it’s a match to the DNA found on the shell casing in Wendy’s hotel room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s all over.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: I worked so hard to put that night – that horrible night behind me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then the break in.

utterance.speaker: KIRBY
utterance.content: Of all the things to steal, my spare eye from off my bureau. That’s when I put it all together. Who the new chauffeur truly was and what he was trying to prove. You have to understand. I couldn’t bring their parents back. I couldn’t. So why should I suffer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kirby Smith, you’re under arrest for the murders of Wendell and Wendy Dupree. And I’m sure that the state of Pennsylvania will be adding two counts of vehicular manslaughter to that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kirby made a full confession. He read an article about a recent mugging in the subway station and decided to kill Wendell there because he knew that the cameras wouldn't be working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the evidence that Wendell stole was still out there. So was his sister Wendy. When she started poking around storage spaces Kirby tracked her to the hotel and shot her.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Worthless bastard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He took out their whole family.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Good job, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she hates me again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, those Gemini dolls obviously meant a lot to her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, wonder what that story is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wonder what those stories are. What are you going to do with all that stuff, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’ll give the climbing equipment to Javier and then, uh … donate the rest, I guess. It served its purpose, brought justice to his family. But it just goes to show you that everyone and everything has a story. Including your little stick man there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … you want to take another shot?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, no. I thought about what you said and you’re right. Just because we’ve been … shaking hands a lot … doesn’t mean I have the right to pry. So when you are ready, you’ll tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We um… we had a reception at our place after my mom’s funeral and it was miserable. I was miserable and my dad took my hand and he said “let’s get the hell out of here, Katie”. And we took the Q Train and we went up to Coney Island. We walked up and down that beach, just enjoying ourselves. We were still in our funeral clothes. And the best part was that we made this little guy out of the twigs and twine that washed up on the shore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does that make that day a bad memory or a good one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Both. He’s a reminder. That even on the worst days there’s the possibility for joy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … we’ll talk tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My little girl.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Alexis’s moving out got me to thinking. And after many hours of soul searching I have made a decision.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you now?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. I have decided, out of the goodness of my heart, to continue to live here –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rent free.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Please don’t interrupt. I will continue to live here, so that you, Richard, will never ever be alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’d do that for me, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s a parent’s sacrifice.
